results.title: English criminal justice
results.brief_description: An explanation of court procedure in England, showing the various types of courts and their particular functions. The cases range from a simple Petty Sessions case to a murder trial at the Old Bailey.

results.title: English children: life in the city
results.brief_description: Junior grade, social studies film showing English family life in the City of York, stressing daily activities of the children. Points out aspects of English home life and presents authentic events in a modern school, on the playground, at a cricket match, and at a grocery store. Concludes with a family holiday trip by train to a nearby seaside resort.

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 7-9.
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Karl McPhee and Ray Quint
results.brief_description: Episode 7, “Paying tax”, follows a group of employed and unemployed young people to illustrate how the Australian taxation system works. In “Working together” workers and employers at a car factory find that co- operation and dialogue can go a long way in removing problems between staff and management. In episode 9, “Reading and writing”, we discover that problems in effective communication and literacy are common and often the reason for poor work performance.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Karl McPhee and Ray Quint

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 4-6.
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Karl McPhee and Mark Sanders
results.brief_description: Episode four, “Being in a union”, is about the various functions performed by trade unions. In “Using public transport” a man used to driving everywhere finds that public transport can turn out to be much more convenient: but only once you can understand timetables and how to access information. And in “Using a phone” information is given on some of the barriers that inhibit people from using a phone effectively.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Karl McPhee and Mark Sanders

results.title: English at work. - Eps. 34-36.
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Michael Karris and Richard Jasek
results.brief_description: The final three episodes of the “English at work” series. In “Helping with problems” we are shown the various ways people can assist others by being good listeners and being prepared to stand up for the rights of others. In “Saving energy” we are shown ways to be more energy efficient at both work and home. “Preventing sexual harassment”. The prevention of sexual harassment and intimidation is shown to be the responsibility of management, workers, and unions: in fact every woman and man needs to object to the practice of harassment in their workplace whenever it occurs.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Michael Karris and Richard Jasek

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 31-33.
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Michael Karris and Richard Jasek
results.brief_description: In “Training for work” advice is given to sole parents who are thinking of rejoining the workforce. Particular attention is paid to the need for adequate childcare and retraining opportunities. The second episode “Driving safely” warns against irresponsible driving behaviour, especially drink- driving and speeding. In “Making job decisions” we follow young people making choices about the work they would like to do, as well as established workers attempting to retrain for different careers.

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 28-30.
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Robert Bull and Michael Karris
results.brief_description: Buying a car, new or used, can often be a stressful time because of the money involved. The first episode of this video details the importance of organising appropriate finance, being sure of exactly what kind of vehicle you need, and knowing what questions to ask dealers (be they a business or an individual) before buying your car. In “Deciding where to live” information is given on the various types of housing that exist in Australia - private, public, rental, home ownership and emergency housing. Episode 30, “Getting your skills recognised” explains the various services available for migrants to Australia to receive assistance in getting overseas qualifications recognised, and also explains how to arrange upgrading skills for the Australian workplace.

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 25-27.
results.creator_credit: Diane Sundin, SBS-TV, Mark Sanders and Ray Quint
results.brief_description: The first episode of this video demonstrates the need for safety precautions at work and at home, and in particular stresses the wearing of protective clothing. In “Building a home” a young couple is offered concise advice on what to do and what not to do when building your own house. The final episode, “Improving health and safety” stresses the necessity of clear, understandable information at the work place on health and safety - including the need for employers, unions and workers to ensure that health and safety information is accessible to all regardless of cultural or linguistic backgrounds.
